{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3182663,"name":"Alex","username":"fedalal","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-07T10:58:25.037Z","cooked":"

Hi,
I’m use Studica VMX controller with Raspberry PI 4 inside.

Using this URL

RobotPy

robotpy-cscore install

RoboRIO installation: If you have robotpy-installer on your computer, then installing robotpy-cscore is very simple: Windows Linux/macOS For additional details about running robotpy-installer on yo...

trying install cscore using command
pip3 install -U robotpy[cscore] --find-links=Index of /~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/

get error messages

In file included from build/temp.linux-armv7l-cpython-37/gensrc/wpiutil/DataLog.cpp:5:
/tmp/pip-install-ec5bem0_/robotpy-wpiutil_c90a9725405949998d26494bb4b109c6/wpiutil/include/wpi/DataLog.h:12:10: fatal error: span: No such file or directory
#include
^~~~~~
compilation terminated.
/tmp/pip-build-env-ptyyddlw/overlay/lib/python3.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/build_py.py:153: SetuptoolsDeprecationWarning: Installing ‘wpiutil.src’ as data is deprecated, please list it in packages.

How can I fix this problem and install robotpy?

Best Regards,
Alex

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-04-07T10:58:25.037Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":102,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":529.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433281,"topic_slug":"cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://robotpy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/install/cscore.html#install-cscore","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"robotpy-cscore install — RobotPy 2023 documentation","clicks":6},{"url":"https://tortall.net/~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Index of /~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58633,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4/433281/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3182669,"name":"Davo","username":"auscompgeek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/auscompgeek/{size}/9867_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-07T11:18:10.295Z","cooked":"

What distro are you using?

WPILib dropped support for distros older than Debian 11 Bullseye this year.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-04-07T11:18:10.295Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433281,"topic_slug":"cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4","display_username":"Davo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI"},"post_url":"/t/cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4/433281/2","custom_user_title":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3182726,"name":"Alex","username":"fedalal","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-07T14:35:38.676Z","cooked":"

Thank you a lot!.
I’m upgrading now to Debian 11 Bullseye and will check.

Anybody has experience with RobotPy and Studica VMX + Titan controllers?
Is it possible use it with RobotPy?

Best Regards,
Alex

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-04-07T14:35:38.676Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":20.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433281,"topic_slug":"cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":31229,"username":"auscompgeek","name":"Davo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/auscompgeek/{size}/9867_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58633,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4/433281/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3182734,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-07T14:43:55.284Z","cooked":"

I don’t think it will work. VMX-PI uses a heavily customized version of WPILIb 2020. Someone would need to create a custom version of robotpy that wrapped that version to be able to talk to any hardware.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-04-07T14:43:55.284Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":19.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433281,"topic_slug":"cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58633,"username":"fedalal","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/87869e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4/433281/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3182738,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-07T14:48:25.172Z","cooked":"
fedalal:

trying install cscore using command
pip3 install -U robotpy[cscore] --find-links=Index of /~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/

If you’re just trying to install/use robotpy-cscore, as long as you’re on a supported distro it should work fine. You can just run:

pip3 install robotpy-cscore --find-links=https://tortall.net/~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/
fedalal:

Anybody has experience with RobotPy and Studica VMX + Titan controllers?
Is it possible use it with RobotPy?

As far as I know you would not be able to use RobotPy to control their controllers.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-04-07T14:48:25.172Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":38.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433281,"topic_slug":"cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/cant-install-robotpy-cscore-on-raspberrypi-4/433281/5","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3182831,"name":"Alex","username":"fedalal","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-07T18:16:40.060Z","cooked":"

Hi,
Thank you for your answers.
I’m install latest version of Raspberry Debian image, but still get error when trying install robotpy modules.

Maybe there is a way to install only cscore python library. I need start CameraServer only from my python program

Best Regards,
Alex

What is the error? And what does cat /etc/os-release provide?

You have to use the command provided above:
pip3 install robotpy-cscore --find-links=https://tortall.net/~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/

Just pip3 install robotpy-cscore will not work.

Best Regards,
Alex
